events.1648: Construction of the Red Fort at Dehli was completed.
events.1791: Lord Cornwallis retreated back to Madras after the battle of Arikera.
events.1857: Sir Ronald Ross, bacteriologist, member of Indian Medical service, Nobel awardee and editor of 'Science Progress', was born at Almora, UP.
events.1883: Henk JFM Sneevliet, leader RSAP/editor Spartacus (Dutch-Indies), was born.
events.1905: Fakruddin Ali Ahmed, the fifth President of India, was born at Delhi.
events.1916: Vasudev Mahadev Salgaonkar, great Industrialist, was born.
events.1918: Balasarswati, famous dancer of Bharat Natyam, was born.
events.1923: Moinul Haque Choudhury, social reformer and politician, was born at Sonabarighat (Assam).
events.1946: Sarwate and Banerjee add 249 runs for the 10th wkt stand for Indians v Surrey.
events.1952: Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru again becomes the Prime Minister of India and forms a new union ministry.
events.1953: The first Indian Navy air station INS Garuda was commissioned at Venduruthy, the naval base in Cochin.
events.1956: Acharya Vinoba Bhave started the Bhoodan campaign in Tiruvellore.
events.1962: Dr. Zakir Hussain became the Vice President (1962-67).
events.1967: Dr. Zakhir Hussain became 3rd President of India. He was the first Muslim President of Indian Union. He held this position till August 24, 1969.
events.1991: P. Sudhir Kumar released in exchange for a few Naxals in jail.
events.1994: Telecom sector opened to private companies under the new national policy announced in Parliament.
events.1995: Renowned environmentalist Maurice F. Strong chosen for the Jawaharlal Nehru International Understanding awarded for 1992.
events.1996: M. Karunanidhi (DMK) sworn in as Tamil Nadu CM.
events.1997: Doordarshan drops plans to enter the direct-to-home (DTH) mode of television transmission.
events.1998: World Bank cancels India donors meet.
events.2000: The Union Government gives its approval for the creation of the three new states of Jharkhand, Uttaranchal and Chhattisgarh to be carved out of Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.
